column18:
CONSENT AGREEMENT
 

Welcome to a decision-making experiment. This study will last approximately 7-10 minutes. There are no risks or discomforts associated with this research beyond those associated with normal decision making in real-world situations. If you agree to participate in this study, you will need to make decisions and provide demographic information. We will not ask for your name or any information that will make you identifiable.

 

Through this work, we hope to gain a better understanding of human decision-making. You will receive $0.20 as compensation for your participation in this study, with the opportunity to earn additional money as a bonus payment. You can expect to receive all payment within a week of completing this study. Your participation in this study is completely voluntary, and you may refuse to participate or withdraw from the study without penalty or loss of benefits to which you may otherwise be entitled. You must be 18 or older to participate.

 

We do not evaluate individual responses and we will only analyze and report general trends. Responses will be identified by an assigned ID number with no names of participants appearing on the response form.

 

If there is anything unclear about your participation in the study or the study itself, or if you wish to report a research-related problem, you may contact the Behavioral Ethics Lab at behavioralethicslab@gmail.com For any questions, concerns, suggestions, or complaints about your rights as a research participant, please contact mbdsmturk@gmail.com.

 
By clicking the consent button, I agree that I have understood the above explanation and give consent to my voluntary participation in this research.

column51:
In this part, you start with 10 ECU in your account

 

You are in a group of 4 participants. Each of you has 10 ECU and is requested to make a decision on how to invest the 10 ECU.

 
There is a private account and a group account. You have to choose how much you want to invest in the group account. The remaining ECU that you choose not to invest in the group account will be invested in the private account. For each ECU invested in the private account, you will receive 1 ECU (= 1:1 ratio). Each ECU invested in the group account will yield 3 ECU for the group (= 1:3 ratio). 



Each person in the group will receive an equal share (one-4th) of the money in the group account regardless of the individual contribution. Every group member can decide independently how much to invest in the group account. 



Please choose the amount that you would like to invest in the group account.
column56:
How do you see yourself: are you generally a person who is fully prepared to take risks or do you try to avoid taking risks?



Please tick a box on the scale, where the value 0 means: ‘not at all willing to take risks’ and the value 10 means: ‘very willing to take risks’.
column67: Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted or that you need to be very careful in dealing with people?

column73:
In this part, you start with 10 ECU in your account

You must decide whether you would like to invest up to 10 ECU in the following lottery:

 

There is a 1/6 (17%) chance that the lottery will “succeed” and you will make 7 times the amount you invested. There is a 5/6 (83%) chance the lottery will “fail” and you will lose the money you invested.

 

Whether the lottery succeeds or fails will be determined as follows: you are assigned the number 6 as your "success number". After you indicate the amount you would like to invest in the lottery, you will be taken to a page where you will click to roll a six-sided die. If the outcome is your “success number” (1/6 chance) then the lottery will succeed and you will make seven times (7x) the amount you invested.  If the outcome is any other number (5/6 chance) then you will lose the amount you invested.

 

Please indicate the amount you would like to invest in the field below.
